3.heading: Mall Models.
3.title: When I Was a Mall Model
3.author: by Monica Gallagher.
notes: "Ever dream of being a model? A glamorous life of fashion, travel, and general awesomeness? Yeah, I did too. Unfortunately, my experience involved blisters, unflattering thongs, wearing oversize negligees, and disappointment. When I Was A Mall Model is an autobiographical tale of trying to be a professional model as a late teen."

12.title: "The Yellow Deserter"
12.author: Anthony Tallarico
12.appears_in: 6 p. in Fighting War Stories, no. 2 (Oct. 1952).
notes: Begins: "When Joe Riley, the B.A.R. man in Sergeant Mallard's squad, was killed in action in Korea, he was replaced by Tommy Lee, a young Chinese-American. Tommy soon found that the battle with the Chinese communists was not the only one he had to fight, and that he'd have to go further than most men to prove that he was an American soldier."

66.heading: Malleoulus, Marcus.
66.title: Beyond the Wall
66.author: writer, Matt Venne ; artist, Gordon Purcell ; colorist, Moose Baumann ; letterer, Neil Uyetake ; editor, Scott Dunbar.
notes: ca. 120 p. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.

"It's the third century A.D. and the tentacles of the Roman Empire have entwined the British Isles. Marcus Malleoulus, veteran of countless military campaigns, has been betrayed by the whim of a tyrant. Now, banished beyond Hadrian's Wall, he faces untold dangers as he fights his way back, determined to survive until revenge is his."

144.heading: Malloy, Bronco Moll.
144.title: "Bronco Moll, the Tigress of Oglala!"
144.author: Dick Rockwell
notes: "Bronco Moll Malloy was the fightin'est filly in the Dakota territory. Worse than any badman, deadlier than any trigger-mad desperado, she blasted out a record of murder that rivals anything the wicked West has to offer in the way of male rottenness! With a cold-blooded ruthlessness matched only by the mankilling felines of the jungle, Bronco Moll wasn't called the Tigress of Oglala for nothing!"

173.heading: Malls.
173.title: "Where's the Bathroom?"
173.author: by Todd Webb
173.appears_in: p. 97-98 in Comic Library International, v. 5 (2000).
notes: Summary: "Bobby seeks relief at the mall with Willy Maykit and Betty Dont!"

174.heading: Malls.
174.title: "You Met Your Mother at the Mall and She Just Blew a Two-Foot Gimme!"
174.author: Hoest & Reiner.
notes: Summary: Leroy is listening to Loretta, and watching golf on TV.

175.heading: Mallscapes.
175.title: Jimbo's Inferno
175.author: Gary Panter.
notes: "A ridiculous mis-recounting of Dante Alighieri's immortal Inferno in which Jimbo, led by Valise, in pursuit of the Soulpinx, enters Focky Bocky, vast Gloomrock mallscape."

176.heading: Mallville Public Library.
176.title: Library Mascot Cage Match : an Unshelved Collection
176.author: by Bill Barnes and Gene Ambaum.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): What's so funny about a library? Just about everything, as you'll find out in Library Mascot Cage Match, the third Unshelved collection. In addition to a year's worth of comic strips featuring library mascots duking it out and the return of the masked mystery man known only as "the Shusher," features the all-new full-color graphic novelette Empire County Strikes Back. Can Mallville's librarians defeat the mother of all bookmobiles?

177.heading: Mallville Public Library.
177.title: Unshelved
177.author: Bill Barnes and Gene Ambaum.
notes: "Volume 1."
Printed version of the daily Internet comic strip.

"At the Mallville Public Library they've seen it all. Like Naked Ned, who takes freedom of expression to new lengths. Or Merv, who does everything in the library but read. Or Buddy the Book Beaver, ex-con tree surgeon turned summer reading program mascot. Or the missing books that keep showing up on eBay. Or the amorous teenagers who won't take it outside. In all this chaos and insanity, who ya gonna call? Why, a librarian of course. But please, do it quietly."

178.heading: "Mallwalker" 3 p. in Stranger in a Strange Land, no. 1 (1989).

179.title: Mallard Fillmore
notes: Newspaper comic strip by Bruce Tinsley
